text:
When a mother isn’t married or 
in a civil partnership, her partner 
can be seen as the child’s 
second parent if both women:
• are treated together in the 
UK by a licensed clinic;
• have made a ‘parenthood 
agreement’.
However, for both parents’ 
details to be recorded on the 
birth	certificate,	they	must	do	
one of the following:
• register the birth jointly;
• complete a ‘Statutory 
declaration of 
acknowledgement of 
parentage’ form and one 
parent takes the signed form 
when she registers
